'''North Davidson Senior High School''' (commonly referred to as "North Davidson," "NDHS," or simply "North") is a public [[high school]] in [[Welcome, North Carolina]] (near [[Lexington, North Carolina|Lexington]]). It was established in 1952 and is located along Old [[US 52|US Highway 52]] in northern [[Davidson County, North Carolina|Davidson County]]. The high school serves the [[Welcome, North Carolina|Welcome]], [[Arcadia, North Carolina|Arcadia]] and [[Midway, North Carolina|Midway]] areas. North Davidson is ranked in the top 5% of public high schools in the [[United States]].<ref>[http://www.newsweek.com/highschools/?s=North+Carolina America's Top Public High Schools | Newsweek Best High Schools | Newsweek.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==Education== Feeder schools are Welcome Elementary (Welcome), Northwest Elementary (Arcadia), Friedberg Elementary (Arcadia), Midway Elementary (Midway), and North Davidson Middle (Welcome).
===Advanced Placement courses=== NDHS offers the following [[Advanced Placement]] courses:
* [[AP English Language and Composition]] * [[AP English Literature and Composition]] * [[AP Statistics]] * [[AP Calculus]] AB & BC * [[AP Chemistry]] * [[AP Biology]] * [[AP US History]] * [[AP Studio Art]] * [[AP Environmental Science]] * [[AP Statistics]] * [[AP European History]] * [[AP Government and Politics]] * [[AP Psychology]]
==Athletics==
The school's mascot is the [[Black Knight]], although girl athletes often use the term "Lady Knights". Enrollment is approximately 1,600 students<ref>[http://www.greatschools.net/modperl/browse_school/nc/574|1 North Davidson High School - Lexington, North Carolina - NC - school overview<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>.
NDHS is a member of the Central Piedmont 4-A Conference and NDHS's biggest county rivals is [[Ledford Senior High School|Ledford]] in [[Wallburg, North Carolina]] and [[Central Davidson High School]] in [[Lexington, North Carolina]]. North's biggest rival in their conference is a tie between [[West Forsyth High School|West Forsyth]] and Davie County High School.
The school's athletics logo is an interlocking "ND" in orange, black, and white colors. It is derived from the [[University of Notre Dame]] athletics logo. Other NDHS logos feature black knights riding upon a unicorn in [[armor]].
